name: inaccessibly
content:
inaccessibly adverb
(DIFFICULT TO REACH)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is very difficult or impossible to travel to or reach: The plants are often clinging inaccessibly to sheer rock-faces. He was given the devastating diagnosis of an inaccessibly deep brain tumour.
More examplesFewer examplesOne of the structures was now located inaccessibly in someone's back garden.The water tank had been inaccessibly locked into the attic.

inaccessibly adverb
(DIFFICULT TO UNDERSTAND)
in a way that is difficult to understand: His writing has a reputation for being inaccessibly scholarly. It is phrased too inaccessibly to make sense.
More examplesFewer examplesThe molecular biology of life seems inaccessibly complex.

inaccessibly adverb
(DIFFICULT TO OBTAIN)
in a way that is difficult to obtain: This made imported goods inaccessibly expensive for many ordinary people.
More examplesFewer examplesMuch government information continues to be filed inaccessibly away, often classified as confidential. The top Japanese restaurants in London are inaccessibly pricey for most of us.
